instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , liquid damaged no signs of corrosion. No orange light & PP3V42 was not present, so I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Macbook powers on, but no battery is detected. If charger is disconnected screen turns off but still have capslock light and fan still spins. Tried with a new battery, no success.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is steady high.
If not, test again disconnecting BIL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Sorry was out for the weekend, but solved. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> was good. The Battery Indicator flex was shorting the board. Thank you for the help.
